{"blocks":[{"key":"3kq34","text":"Fill bottles for the CODEX Instrument accordingly:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o3a7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"udbq","text":"Bottle 1 - 1X CODEX Buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebja6","text":"Bottle 2 - DMSO","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4c8v8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ablu","text":"⚠ Make sure the Waste Bottle is empty.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aidar","text":"Launch the CODEX Instrument Manger (CIM) software. Load or create an experiment template and input appropriate labels under Project, Experiment, and Operator fields.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":124,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":133,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":149,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dh1e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aj85","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":14,"offset":68}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dlh6h","text":"Instructions described here are based on CIM version 1.30.0.12; see CODEX® Support for more information.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"3D87E637C5A011EC97780A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://help.codex.bio/codex/cim/overview"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5qj9v","text":"Specify the number of cycles in Total #Cycles and enter the Start Cycle Well (the first well in the reporter plate for the experiment).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":60,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7f0h0","text":"Double check template contents, including marker names, classes, and exposure times. Set Z-Stack Planes to 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":89,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fndvk","text":"Prime the instrument: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b02nt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bstkr","text":"Briefly soak a gasket in 1X CODEX Buffer. Load a blank coverslip onto the stage plate and place gasket on top. Fit the stage insert, tighten, and place the assembly on a horizontal surface (in a plastic collection container or on the benchtop). Click Prime on the Experiment Start Wizard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":251,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3819","text":"Load sample: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34a2b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dvcb","text":"Once the machine is finished priming, remove the stage insert and gasket and discard the blank coverslip. Carefully load the sample coverslip into the stage plate, place gasket on top, and tighten the stage insert. Remove any buffers or salts from bottom of the coverslip using a Kimwipe dipped in water. Next, situate the stage plate/stage insert into the holder of the Keyence BZ-X810 microscope, making sure fluidics lines can exit through the front of the microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":125,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63n7a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ao2k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lk9k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ots5","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F9C04990C7FB11ECB277B9D183D1D45D","height":223.56363636363636,"id":239098,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"ilgu","text":"Figure 2. View of stage plate and stage insert before loading coverslip (left) and after being fitted into the Keyence BZ-X810 microscope (right).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjr6bh5qp.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjr4bh5qp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjr5bh5qp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjr3bh5qp.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rdvu","text":"Load a blank coverslip and perform a Clean Instrument Wash by navigating to the Maintenance tab. to Multi-Color","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du3ga","text":"Enable all four fluorescent channels (DAPI, GFP, TRITC, Cy5)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crt5g","text":"Set all channel pseudocolors to white","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1021u","text":"Set Excitation Light to 100% and enable Low Photobleach","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ibst","text":"Set camera to Mono","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64bn2","text":"Set Resolution Sensitivity to High Resolution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ej2f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7db7u","text":"In Options tab:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23sl5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cikd","text":"Select Z-Stack  -\u003e Multi-Color","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9etkh","text":"Enable Gain and Transmitted Light Power","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63fpb","text":"Enable Excitation Light Filter","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sg1p","text":"Choose 14bit under TIFF Image Setting","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5kdp","text":"Enable Automatically Save Image and set Format to TIFF","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqg8h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b7ii","text":"Under Capture Area Settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55rue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chv5t","text":"Enable Z-Stack","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9git0","text":"Enter 1.5 μm for Pitch","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebmfn","text":"Enable Stitching","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"or6n","text":"Choose Set Center and Number of Images","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"859vv","text":"Set Z-stack parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0kb3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34ggi","text":"Ensure that the tissue is situated over the objective, moving the stage using the BZ-X Viewer as needed. Switch to the DAPI channel and perform autofocus to locate the tissue. At multiple points across the tissue, find and note the optimal focus (Z position). If values are within ~5 μm of each other, scroll to the center Z position and under Capture Area Settings, select Fix Range and click Set. Range should correspond to 5 images (Z-stacks), approximately ~6 μm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":374,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":394,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49ues","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9152","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av3a8","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8e26m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"brq78","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B1295980C6FF11ECAF3FBFC9909645A2","height":144.60465116279067,"id":239102,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjsabh5qp.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjr8bh5qp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjr9bh5qp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjr7bh5qp.webp","width":239.15384615384613}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":14,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dgq8t","text":"If values are not within 5 μm of each other, clean underside of coverslip and check that the stage plate/insert are securely in place. If the Z positions are still varied across different areas of the tissue, the Range (BZ-X Viewer) and Z-stack planes (CIM) may be increased as needed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5uuda","text":"Set imaging region:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"871ej","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b3hv","text":"Bring up the Navigation window, adding regions as needed to locate the edges of the tissue. Use these macro stitched images to approximate the center of the tissue and click Add.  Define region size by setting the number of X and Y images (tiles) under Capture Area Settings. Without changing positions, scroll back through stored regions and ensure that the green box (denoting the captured area) includes the tissue edges. Adjust center and/or X and Y numbers as needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":174,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t2qa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6oebs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcpg7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5kb7n","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enj2j","text":"Once you are satisfied with the imaging region, delete all other regions stored in the Navigation window so that only the central region remains. Select Start Capture and specify the file path for images to be saved (folder should match Experiment name). Press Stop after a few images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":153,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":261,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"55F75A90C7FD11ECB277B9D183D1D45D","height":275.23636363636365,"id":239106,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"a8bmb","text":"Figure 3. Schematic depicting the imaged region (green outline) across a series of tiles (magenta). These parameters represent the x and y dimensions, while the Z-Stack range corresponds to the z dimension.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjsebh5qp.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjscbh5qp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjsdbh5qp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hjsbbh5qp.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dj92k","text":"Empty the vacuum waste container and small solution containers under the hood. Rinse, and leave to dry on paper towels. Remove reporter plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52p6a","text":"Load the prepared reporter plate, noting the coordinates of the first well containing solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"194hh","text":"Shut down BZ-X Viewer and CIM software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
